name: bits0oALTV

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, codd), wcel(nat0, cfv(cbits, c0)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, codd), wb(wcel(nat0, cfv(cbits, c0)), wcel(c0, codd)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Odd → 0 ∈(bits ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Odd →(0 ∈(bits ` c0)↔ c0 ∈ Odd))

|- wi(wcel(c0, codd), wcel(nat0, cfv(cbits, c0)))

cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Odd → 0 ∈(bits ` c0))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Odd →(0 ∈(bits ` c0)↔ c0 ∈ Odd))

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, codd), wb(wcel(nat0, cfv(cbits, c0)), wcel(c0, codd)), wcel(c0, cz))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ Odd, (0 ∈(bits ` c0)↔ c0 ∈ Odd), c0 ∈ ℤ)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, codd), wb(wcel(nat0, cfv(cbits, c0)), wcel(c0, codd)))

body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Odd →(0 ∈(bits ` c0)↔ c0 ∈ Odd))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Odd → c0 ∈ ℤ)
⊣ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(0 ∈(bits ` c0)↔ c0 ∈ Odd))

⊣ (c0 ∈ ℤ →(0 ∈(bits ` c0)↔ c0 ∈ Odd))

cumulated.origin:

comment: The zeroth bit of an odd number is zero. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Sep-2016.) (Revised by AV, 19-Jun-2020.)
